PP PSTE Direvisi Demi Perjelas Sanksi Pelanggar
05 Nov 2019, 13:30 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi data center. (Foto: Google)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika (Kemenkominfo) mempertegas bahwa revisi Peraturan Pemerintah Penyelenggaraan Sistem Transaksi Elektronik (PP PSTE) dilakukan untuk mempertegas sanksi bagi pelanggar. Hal ini diungkap terkait perubahan Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 71 Tahun 2019 PSTE yang disahkan Oktober lalu.Â Menurut Kemenkominfo keberadaan PP PSTE baru telah mengatur berbagai macam sanksi bagi penyedia sistem elektronik (PSE). Platform media sosial Facebook dan sejenis lain diharapkan patuh pada aturan demi kelancaran berdigitalisasi saat ini."PP PSTE yang baru sudah mengatur adanya sanksi bagi pelanggarnya. Hal ini tak ada di PP PSTE yang lama," ujar Dirjen Aplikasi Informatika (Aptika) Kemenkominfo Semuel Abrijani Pangerapan dalam Forum Merdeka Barat (FMB) 9, Jakarta, Senin (4/11).Lebih lanjut ia mengatakan dalam PP PSTE juga telah membahas mengenai keamanan siber hingga prinsip-prinsip dasar Perlindungan Data Pribadi. PSE wajib memenuhi prinsip-prinsip perlindungan data pribadi tersebut.Semuel mengatakan dalam PP PSTE juga akan diterapkan sanksi bagi PSE, di antaranya hingga pemutusan akses atau pemblokiran.Menurut Semuel, PP Nomor 71 PSTE dirasa cukup memiliki terobosan. Pasalnya, bila dibandingkan sebelumnya, PP PSTE tak ada sanksi yang bisa menjerat penyelenggara layanan digital jika tak menaruh pusat datanya di Indonesia."Dalam PP yang lama tidak ada sanksi. Sedangkan yang baru ini nantinya ada sanksi. Seminim-minimnya adalah pemblokiran," jelas dia.Dalam PP tersebut mengatur soal penempatan fisik data center (DC) dan data recovery center (DRC) harus ada di Indonesia. Oleh karena itu ia mengatakan perlu ada klasifikasi data yang akan diatur dalam aturan turunan berupa Peraturan Menteri. "Dalam aturan yang lama itu mengatur fisiknya, padahal yang penting itu datanya. Saat ini kami mensyaratkan datanya bukan hanya fisiknya," terang dia. (jnp/mik)

PP PSTE Revised To Clarify Penal Sanctions
05 Nov 2019, 13:30 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of data center. (Photo: Google)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology (Kemenkominfo) emphasized that the revision of the Government Regulation for the Implementation of Electronic Transaction Systems (PP PSTE) was carried out to reinforce sanctions for violators. This was revealed related to changes in Government Regulation No. 71 of 2019 PSTE which was passed last October. According to the Ministry of Communication and Information the existence of the new PSTE PP has set various sanctions for electronic system providers (PSE). Facebook social media platforms and other similar types are expected to abide by the rules for the smooth running of the current digitization. "The new PP PSTE has arranged sanctions for violators. Pangerapan in the West Merdeka Forum (FMB) 9, Jakarta, Monday (4/11). Furthermore he said in the PP PSTE also had discussed about cyber security to the basic principles of Personal Data Protection. PSE is obliged to fulfill the principles of personal data protection. Semuel said that in the PP PSTE sanctions will also be applied to PSE, including termination of access or blocking. According to Semuel, PP No. 71 PSTE is considered to have enough breakthroughs. The reason is, if compared to before, PP PSTE has no sanctions that could ensnare digital service providers if they did not put their data centers in Indonesia. "In the old PP there were no sanctions. Whereas the new ones would later be sanctioned. he. The PP regulates the matter of physical data center (DC) and data recovery center (DRC) placement in Indonesia. Therefore he said that there needed to be a classification of data that would be regulated in a derivative rule in the form of a Ministerial Regulation. "In the old rules, it governed the physical, even though the important thing is the data. At present we require that the data is not only physical," he explained. (jnp / mic)
